verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to the Gittith. A Psalm of Asaph. Sing <S%H7321>aloud<s%> unto <S%H430>God<s%> our <S%H5797>strength<s%>: Make a joyful <S%H7321>noise<s%> unto the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>.
Raise <S%H5375><s%> a <S%H2172>song<s%>, and <S%H5414>bring<s%> hither the <S%H8596>timbrel<s%>, The <S%H5273>pleasant<s%> <S%H3658>harp<s%> with the <S%H5035>psaltery<s%>.
Blow <S%H8628><s%> the <S%H7782>trumpet<s%> at the new <S%H2320>moon<s%>, At the full <S%H2320>moon<s%>, on our <S%H2282>feast<s%> - <S%H3117>day<s%>.
For it is a <S%H2706>statute<s%> for <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, An <S%H4941>ordinance<s%> of the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>.

He <S%H7760>appointed<s%> it in <S%H3084>Joseph<s%> for a <S%H5715>testimony<s%>, When he went <S%H3318>out<s%> over the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>, Where I <S%H8085>heard<s%> a <S%H8193>language<s%> that I knew <S%H3045>not<s%>.
I <S%H5493>removed<s%> his <S%H7926>shoulder<s%> from the <S%H5447>burden<s%>: His <S%H3709>hands<s%> were <S%H5674>freed<s%> from the <S%H1731>basket<s%>.

Thou <S%H7121>calledst<s%> in <S%H6869>trouble<s%>, and I <S%H2502>delivered<s%> <S%H6030>thee<s%>; I answered thee in the secret <S%H5643>place<s%> of <S%H7482>thunder<s%>; I <S%H974>proved<s%> thee at the <S%H4325>waters<s%> of <S%H4809>Meribah<s%>. <S%H5542><s%>[[Selah
Hear <S%H8085><s%>, O my <S%H5971>people<s%>, and I will <S%H5749>testify<s%> unto <S%H3478>thee<s%>: O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto <S%H8085>me<s%>!
There shall no <S%H2114>strange<s%> <S%H410>god<s%> be in <S%H7812>thee<s%>; Neither shalt thou worship any <S%H5236>foreign<s%> <S%H410>god<s%>.

I am <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>, Who <S%H5927>brought<s%> thee up out of the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>: Open thy <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7337>wide<s%>, and I will fill <S%H4390>it<s%>.
But my <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H8085>hearkened<s%> not to my <S%H6963>voice<s%>; And <S%H3478>Israel<s%> would none of <S%H14>me<s%>.
So I let them <S%H7971>go<s%> after the <S%H8307>stubbornness<s%> of their <S%H3820>heart<s%>, That they might <S%H3212>walk<s%> in their own <S%H4156>counsels<s%>.
Oh <S%H3863><s%> that my <S%H5971>people<s%> would <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto <S%H3478>me<s%>, That Israel would <S%H1980>walk<s%> in my <S%H1870>ways<s%>!
I would <S%H4592>soon<s%> <S%H3665>subdue<s%> their <S%H341>enemies<s%>, And <S%H7725>turn<s%> my <S%H3027>hand<s%> against their <S%H341>adversaries<s%>.
The <S%H8130>haters<s%> of <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> should <S%H3584>submit<s%> themselves unto <S%H6256>him<s%>: But their time should endure for <S%H5769>ever<s%>.
He would <S%H398>feed<s%> them also with the <S%H2459>finest<s%> of the <S%H2406>wheat<s%>; And with <S%H1706>honey<s%> out of the <S%H6697>rock<s%> would I satisfy <S%H7646>thee<s%>.
